history.content: Not necessary for the course (like most CS texts), but I'd say it's a pretty good reference text and if you really enjoy operating systems, it can even be a interesting leisure or academic read. Whether it's worth is a question of your finances and if you think you'll ever actually open it. It's nice and thick though so at worst its a decent if expensive paperweight or stand.

children.subject: I’m a 162 TA, I think this book is amazing! Although it’s not required for the class, it’s a great read. Shoot me an email at neil.kulkarni@berkeley.edu and I can show you how to obtain a copy of the book for cheap.

history.content: Just wondering if the Anderson textbook was worth buying or not.  I usually buy the required books for CS, but in my 2+ years so far, other than my Linear Algebra book for 16A/B, I have hardly even opened any of the other books.
history.subject: 162 textbook worth it?
